lines.text: Car.
Beep, beep.
[Marlowe tries to walk away, but is blocked by the Thug]
Car.
For a guy with a limited vocabulary, you sure do manage to get your point across.
May I reach for my pocket?
It would give me great pleasure to see you do something foolish.
You know where I can find Mavis?
Mavis?
She's not over at her place.
Why should I turn you over to her?
Because underneath the pasties is a size 40 heart.
[Dolores rolls her eyes]
I thought you liked Mavis.
I do like her, but why should she get all of the goodies?
You're light on your feet, Winslow. Are you just a little gay, huh?
I like a man that uses good grammar. You impress me mister Wong. Whom sent you?
You're so good, Miss Wald. You're so good you could act your way out of a safety deposit box.

[after a goon has just ripped up his jacket]
Does your mother know what you do for a living?

[responding, mid-striptease, to Philip Marlowe's question]
The streets are paved with forgotten husbands!
[first lines]
How do I get in to see the manager?
[the man he's talking to points him in the right direction]
Thank you.

[pulling a gun on Marlowe]
Turn around.
If that were a .45, I wouldn't argue. But a .32, I can get in a couple of words.
[Mavis raises the gun higher]
I've said them all... But don't forget you're a lady.
I'm Dolores... with an 'O.' Dolores Gonzáles.
Isn't that Spanish for pain?

[with a gun held on him]
I like your perfume. What is it?
Well, you're very impressive, Winslow, but I've seen dogs do better on television.
Were you here when he got it?
No.
Who was?
He was.
That's your exit line, Marlowe. Follow it out.
[last lines]
Hello? Hello?
[long pause]
Hello?
